item.title: Friday’s big stock stories: What’s likely to move the market in the next trading session
item.description: Stocks slid on Thursday, with the 30-stock Dow slipping about 450 points. Here's what CNBC is watching going into Friday.

item.title: GameStop CEO Ryan Cohen hikes his personal stake in Alibaba to $1 billion, WSJ says
item.description: Cohen's sizable stake in Alibaba is a bullish bet on China's economic growth in the long run, The Wall Street Journal said.

item.title: Investors are flocking to this higher-yielding tax-free corner of the bond market
item.description: High-yield muni bond funds and ETFs collected sizable inflows over the past year — and investors are getting attractive returns.

item.title: Cruise stocks tumble after Commerce Secretary Lutnick signals tax crackdown
item.description: Royal Caribbean was the hardest hit.

item.title: Palantir drops for a second day as cult stock loses momentum
item.description: Wednesday's decline came as investors keyed in on the CEO's new stock sale plan and the possibility of defense cuts.
